meanings.definition: To make global or worldwide in scope or application.
meanings.sent1: The company globalises its products by selling them in many countries.
meanings.sent2: The internet globalises communication, allowing people from different countries to connect instantly.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking robot globalises the concept of technology taking over the world.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter globalises joy, spreading happiness everywhere she goes.
meanings.sent5: The colorful map globalises the concept of diversity, showing all the different countries in the world.

meanings.definition: To extend to all parts of the world.
meanings.sent1: The pandemic globalises quickly, affecting people in every corner of the world.
meanings.sent2: Technology globalises information, making it accessible to everyone around the globe.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the talking dog globalises, reaching even the most remote villages.
meanings.sent4: His kindness globalises, touching hearts across continents.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers globalises, filling the air with a sweet fragrance worldwide.
